appendix.title: MIME Type for XLIFF Version 2.0 and Later Releases
appendix.para: A MIME type (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions type) is a two-part identifier for file formats and format content transmitted on the Internet. The MIME type is the mechanism used to tell a client application the type of document being transferred from a server. It is important that servers are set up correctly so that the correct MIME type is transferred with each document.
XLIFF is registered in the IANA Media Types Registry as application/xliff+xml.
